001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Decorator;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.activations.ActivationFunction;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * A specialized {@link Neuron} that remembers the input values
010 * from its most recent activation.
011 * <p>
012 * This class extends the basic neuron by capturing and storing the
013 * raw outputs of its input neurons during the forward pass. The stored
014 * inputs do not affect the computation of the neuron’s output but
015 * provide additional visibility or state for downstream processing,
016 * such as training algorithms, debugging, or interpretability tools.
017 * </p>
018 *
019 * <h2>Behavior</h2>
020 * <ul>
021 *   <li>On {@link #activate()}, performs the standard neuron computation
022 *       (weighted sum + bias → activation function) and also stores a copy
023 *       of the input values provided by connected neurons.</li>
024 *   <li>The stored inputs can be retrieved via {@link #getStoredInputs()}.</li>
025 *   <li>Stored inputs can be explicitly cleared with
026 *       {@link #clearStoredInputs()} to release memory or reset state
027 *       between training iterations.</li>
028 * </ul>
029 */
030@Decorator
031public class LastInputStoredNeuron extends Neuron {
032
033    private float[] storedInputs;
034
035    /**
036     * Constructs a neuron that stores the inputs from its most recent activation.
037     *
038     * @param name               human-readable identifier
039     * @param inputs             input neurons feeding into this neuron
040     * @param activationFunction activation function to apply after weighted sum
041     */
042    public LastInputStoredNeuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
043        super(name, inputs, activationFunction);
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Activates this neuron by performing the normal weighted sum
048     * and activation function, and additionally storing the raw input
049     * values from connected neurons.
050     */
051    public synchronized void activate() {
052        if (isActivated()) {
053            return;
054        }
055        super.activate();
056        storedInputs = new float[getInputs().size()];
057        for (int i = 0; i < getInputs().size(); i++) {
058            storedInputs[i] = getInputs().get(i).getOutput();
059        }
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Returns the inputs stored during the last activation.
064     *
065     * @return the most recent input values, or {@code null} if the neuron
066     * has not been activated or if stored inputs were cleared
067     */
068    public float[] getStoredInputs() {
069        return storedInputs;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Clears the stored inputs, releasing memory and resetting state.
074     */
075    public synchronized void clearStoredInputs() {
076        storedInputs = null;
077    }
078
079}
